app_metadata.description: Terraria is a land of adventure! A land of mystery! A land that's yours to shape, defend, and enjoy.
app_metadata.name: terraria
app_metadata.title: Terraria

attrs.label: Image
attrs.description:
Selects the image to use for the Terraria server.</br>
TShock is a fork of the Terraria server that adds a number of features.</br>
Vanilla is the original Terraria server. </br>
Only applies to newly generated worlds.

attrs.label: World Name
attrs.description:
Sets the world's name.</br>
Only applies to newly generated worlds.

schema.valid_chars_error: World name must be [numbers, letters, and hyphens only]

attrs.label: World Seed
attrs.description:
Sets the world's seed.</br>
Only applies to newly generated worlds.

attrs.label: World Evil
attrs.description:
Sets the world's evil state.</br>
Only applies to newly generated worlds.

attrs.label: World Size
attrs.description:
Sets the world's size.</br>
Only applies to newly generated worlds.

attrs.label: World Difficulty
attrs.description:
Sets the world's difficulty.</br>
Only applies to newly generated worlds.

attrs.label: Maximum Players
attrs.description: Starts the server with the given player count as the maximum.

attrs.label: Server Password
attrs.description: Sets the server password.

attrs.label: Secure Server
attrs.description: Turns on the base game's "anti-spam" feature.

attrs.label: Force Update
attrs.description:
Forces the server to continue running, and not hibernating when no players are on. </br>
This results in time passing, grass growing, and cpu running.

attrs.label: Additional Arguments
attrs.description:
Configure additional arguments for Terraria. </br>
Value is optional for flags like -heaptile </br>
For example: </br>
Key: -lang </br>
Value: en-US

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Terraria.

attrs.label: Server Port
attrs.description: The port for Terraria Server

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.

attrs.label: Terraria World Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Terraria World.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

1.1.1.readme:
Terraria

Terraria is a land of adventure! A land of mystery! A land that's yours to shape, defend, and enjoy.

NOTE: The following applies only for the TShock image. On the first run, you have to check the logs to get the server token. You will find something like this:

text Login before join enabled. Users may be prompted for an account specific password instead of a server password on connect. Login using UUID enabled. Users automatically login via UUID. A malicious server can easily steal a user's UUID. You may consider turning this option off if you run a public server. TShock Notice: setup-code.txt is still present, and the code located in that file will be used. To setup the server, join the game and type /setup 424041 This token will display until disabled by verification. (/setup)

Join the server and run /setup <token>
